com.isbx.androidtools.media

Class MediaPicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isbx.androidtools.media.MediaPicker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback

    public class MediaPicker
extends Object
implements ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback
    This class provides a simple mechanism to prompt the user to provide an audio/video media file.

    There are three main ways a user can provide a media file to the application:

    • Taking a photo from the camera app
    • Recording a video from the camera app
    • Selecting a media file from their device's media library

    By default, all of these options are enabled, but they can be configured using setPhotoCameraEnabled(boolean), setVideoEnabled(boolean), and setPhotoLibraryEnabled(boolean) respectively.

    Once you have configured the MediaPicker instance, a call to showChooser() will present a dialog to the user to choose which of the available media sources they would like to use. In order to receive the result from the user action, implement the MediaPicker.MediaPickerListener interface which will be called with a Uri representing the media the user has selected.

    MediaPicker defers to the built in camera and library apps to actually retrieve the appropriate media file. MediaPicker handles this logic internally, but in order for it to work you must be sure to call onActivityResult(int, int, Intent) from the appropriate method in your fragment or activity (Fragment.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent), Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent). For example, to use MediaPicker from an activity: 

     @Override
 protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode, int resultCode, Intent data) {
     super.onActivityResult(requestCode, resultCode, data);
     mediaPicker.onActivityResult(requestCode, resultCode, data);
 }

    Similarly, apps that target API 23 and up and also include the Manifest.permission.CAMERA permission in their manifest should pass through calls to Activity.onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[]): 

     @Override
 protected void onRequestPermissionsResult(int requestCode, String[] permissions, int[] grantResults) {
     super.onRequestPermissionsResult(requestCode, permissions, grantResults);
     mediaPicker.onRequestPermissionsResult(requestCode, permissions, grantResults);
 }

    This is due to a quirk beginning in API 23 that requires the user to grant the application access to the camera if the permission is declared in the manifest. As long as you call onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[]) from your activity/fragment, MediaPicker will handle the permission checking and requesting automatically. If you are targeting an API below 23, or you do not declare Manifest.permission.CAMERA in your manifest, you do not need to do this.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MediaPicker

        public MediaPicker(Activity activity)
        Creates a new MediaPicker tied to the given Activity. The activity will be used internally to show the picker dialog and to start intents to the device's camera/library apps.
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity to use for this MediaPicker

    • Method Detail

      • onActivityResult

        public void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                             int resultCode,
                             Intent data)
        Handles results from the device's built in camera/media library apps. This should be invoked directly from either Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent) or Fragment.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent).
        Parameters:
        requestCode - The requestCode that was passed in to startActivityForResult()
        resultCode - The resultCode from the returning activity, set by Activity.setResult(int)
        data - The data Intent from the returning activity, set by Activity.setResult(int, Intent)
        See Also:
        Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent), Fragment.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent)

      • onRequestPermissionsResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsResult(int requestCode,
                                       @NonNull
                                       String[] permissions,
                                       @NonNull
                                       int[] grantResults)

        Handles results for requesting the Manifest.permission.CAMERA permission. This should be invoked directly from either Activity.onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[]) or Fragment.onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[]) if and only if you satisfy both of the following conditions:

        • Your app's targetSdkVersion is set to 23 or higher
        • You declare <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.CAMERA" /> in your manifest file
        Specified by:
        onRequestPermissionsResult in interface ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback
        See Also:
        Activity.onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[]), Fragment.onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[])

      • setPhotoCameraEnabled

        public void setPhotoCameraEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether or not the media picker dialog will have an option to take a picture.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if option to take a photo should be available, false otherwise
        See Also:
        showChooser()

      • setPhotoLibraryEnabled

        public void setPhotoLibraryEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether or not the media picker dialog will have an option to choose from the media library.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if option to choose from the media library should be available, false otherwise
        See Also:
        showChooser()

      • setVideoEnabled

        public void setVideoEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether or not the media picker dialog will have an option to record a video.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if option to record a video should be available, false otherwise
        See Also:
        showChooser()

      • setMediaPickerListener

        public void setMediaPickerListener(MediaPicker.MediaPickerListener listener)
        Sets the listener object to be notified when the user selects a media object
        Parameters:
        listener - The MediaPicker.MediaPickerListener to be notified of the user's media selection

      • showChooser

        public void showChooser()
        Presents a simple alert dialog to the user with options to either take a photo, record a video, or choose a media file from their library, depending on which sources are enabled for this MediaPicker. Once the user makes a selection, they will be taken to the appropriate app (camera or media library), where they can perform the necessary action. The result of this action will be passed to this MediaPicker's MediaPicker.MediaPickerListener.
        See Also:
        setPhotoCameraEnabled(boolean), setPhotoLibraryEnabled(boolean), setVideoEnabled(boolean)
